article:
'Self-determination' is the idea of a positive freedom, a freedom for actions
that we originate, actions that are "up to us." Such acts constitute the essence
of free will. This is Mortimer Adler's term, translating ideas from Aristotle
and Aquinas. It was adopted also by Robert Kane for his theory of Ultimate
Responsibility.

The technical terms Determination R. E. Hobart, "Free Will as Requiring
Determination, and Inconceivable Without It," Mind, Vol XLIII, 169 (1934)
p.2 and Adequate determinism Bob Doyle, "Jamesian Free Will: The Two-
stage Model of WIlliam James," William James Studies, April 2010 have been
proposed as preferable to determinism to describe actions that are
[http://www.informationphilosopher.com/freedom/adequate_determinism.html
adequately determined] by an agent's current reasons, motives, and desires, as
opposed to the strict predeterminism by a causal chain of events going back
before the agent's birth.
